title: Version requested in packages.yaml not respected
body:
I requested the following in my packages.yaml:

```
    pism:
        version: [local]
```

There is no version called "local" in pism/package.py; only 0.7.3.  The "local" version was installed by running "spack diy" (actually, spack spconfig, which is pretty equivalent for our purposes here).

I then requested:

```
spack spec icebin@local +python +coupler +pism ^netlib-lapack+shared ^netlib-blas+fpic ^netcdf+mpi ^eigen~suitesparse ^python@3:
```

Spack tried to get pism@0.7.3, ignoring the request for local in packages.py.  My guess is it did an algorithm as follows:
1. User made no version request on command line.
2. Default in packages.yaml is "lcoal"; let's see if we can find such a version.
3. pism/packages.py doesn't list any version called "local," so let's throw that out
4. No other defaults are listed in packages.yaml, so just use the latest version listed in pism/packages.py

Not sure what the best approach to solving this issue is.  For now, I'm adding "^pism@local" to my command lines.
